metadata.title: CVE-2020-13543 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A code execution vulnerability exists in the WebSocket functionality ofWebkit WebKitGTK 2.30.0. A specially crafted web page can trigger ause-after-free vulnerability which can lead to remote code execution. Anattacker can get a user to visit a webpage to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13543` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.30.3-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.30.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.30.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.30.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.30.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.30.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.30.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.30.3-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.30.3-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.30.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.3-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
